text: Hi, which API i use to know form submission by source?

Hey all, I'm playing around with the Create Custom Contact Property api (<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/v2/create_contacts_property>) and I cannot get the display order to work as I expect. I'm successfully creating the new contact properties, but no matter what the new property is at the top of my property lists. See passed json and screenshot below:

```data = {
  "name": "newcustomproperty5",
  "label": "A New Custom Property 5",
  "description": "A new property for you",
  "groupName": "contactinformation",
  "type": "string",
  "fieldType": "text",
  "formField": "True",
  "displayOrder": 6,
  "options": [
    
  ]
}```
Webhook Throttling - anyone know if this works? <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Webhook-APP-throttling-doesn-t-work/m-p/359264#M35327>

My guess would be something is wrong with the name or content of your ID column... the Import is picky and glitchy... the ID field must be named EXACTLY right and have the EXACT right content. I would advise doing an Export to learn how the format works before trying an Import

Failing that try reading all the endpoints which look like this, for your object type:

POST /crm/v3/objects/companies/batch/create
Lots of the latter, not a lot of the format, can you be more specific what is missing and broken and maybe we can help?

There are a number of things you can do

Do you need real time sync and update or periodic batch sync and update

Which one you need makes a huge difference

If you have more specifics what you are trying we could comment more

It kind of depends exactly what you mean but it can be as easy as

<https://app.HubSpot.com/contacts/HUB_ID/contact/CONTACT_VID/>

Sadly the Owners API and the stuff on top of it is kind of incompatible, limited, and lackluster compared to the APIs of the other object types; you can't even get the phone number to put on documents from the normal Owners API

Sadly, I have only made the Tickets using the backend Tickets API and not the Form approach. When I looked at the Service Form approach I found it was incredibly badly documented and I could not get very far. But if you want help to get it going with the Tickets API I could help. Given it's a regression you might need to submit a support ticket

I am not sure I fully understand the question but have you looked at <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/email-tracking/connect-your-inbox-to-HubSpot> ? It would make contacts if you connect it to your Gmail / G Suite...

If you read the recent room history, there was a thread, where `IN` used to exist but was then desupported. Some of us complained based on the same grounds that the filtering is inadequate without that operator. You might have to kludge around it by applying narrowest filter you can and then post-proc on client side.

there were some changes where the default property order for all users cannot easily be set but you can customize the display order for your own user very easily

as a CRM admin (not API dev) this really irritates me but is not high enough up my list to complain about it, however if you make an Idea in the forum to majorly fix how they handle default listing order of CRM properties I am good for an upvote
might have to using something like <https://github.com/rq/rq> or a hand made redis queue to absorb this while you figure out the issue

Thanks - already using Pub/Sub and Google APP engine. Think there might be an issue with the actual error logs in HubSpot. As says it error’d for attempt 0… then the next attempt is successful but has the same timestamp.

Then when I check pub/sub queue it has the correct number of records.
Hmm, yeah, if the logging is not right then it probably needs some tech intervention from their side
Whenever I see an error on attempt #0 I would be thinking of an off-by-one programming issue likely in the code somehow
Definitely seems like something funny going on with it.
